messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Weird Tsuba
messages.msgSnippet: I have to say this isn t a tsuba. I don t even see any reason to think that it is Japanese.  I know that someone is offering this on EBay as a tsuba, but I
messages.messageBody:
I have to say this isn't a tsuba. I don't even see any reason to think
that it is Japanese. I know that someone is offering this on EBay as a
tsuba, but I would hazard that he is mistaken.

Bob

apedraza@... wrote:
>
> Anyone want to venture a guess as to what this is? while I'm not an
> expert, I do confess I've never seen the like. Is it an authentic
> anything?
> I hope this link works, it's the only pic in the album:
> http://photos.groups.yahoo.com/group/nihontostudy/lst?.dir=/Andres&.src=gr&.view=

> Andres


--
Robert J. Gilmore, MS, DVM

<rgilmore82@...> office

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Weird Tsuba
messages.msgSnippet: Light switch plate? Hmmm...very strange. Wouldn t lose any sleep over it. Ron STL ... From: apedraza@valornewmedia.com To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com Sent:
messages.messageBody:
Light switch plate? Hmmm...very strange. Wouldn't lose any sleep over it.

Ron
STL
----- Original Message -----
From: apedraza@...
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, October 06, 2004 4:12 PM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Weird Tsuba



Anyone want to venture a guess as to what this is? while I'm not an
expert, I do confess I've never seen the like. Is it an authentic
anything? And what sort of weapon is this "tsuba" supposed to go on? I
can't see it as being functional due to the position of the hole for
the blade.

I hope this link works, it's the only pic in the album:
http://photos.groups.yahoo.com/group/nihontostudy/lst?.dir=/Andres&.src=gr&.view=

If it doesn't, can you look at the photo albums in the Yahoogroups page
and open the Album called Andres? That will take you there, too.

Best Regards,

Andres
